newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean students clash with riot police.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean students clash with riot police.

text.p: Several thousand South Korean students wielding metal pipes and firebombs clashed with riot police on Monday in the fourth day of protests to demand the resignation of President Kim Young-sam, witnesses said.
Violence broke out as marching students approached the gates of Hanyang University and were blocked by squadrons of riot police.
Later, a Reuter photographer on the scene said a large number of students and riot police were injured during fierce fighting when marchers broke through police lines.
"A lot of policemen are lying on the street, and they seem badly hurt," Yun Suk-bong said.
In addition, he said students had seized about 10 officers and were holding them outside the college gates where some 3,000 students were massing.
Prosecutors on Monday vowed to "deal sternly" with the worst student violence in almost a year.
